Possible complications of basedowian ophthalmopathy are :

- Corneal damage of variable severity, secondary to significant, non-reducible exophthalmos, with [[Palpebral anomalies SD-139|Palpebral inocclusion]].

- Neuropathy due to compression of the optic nerve, which is extremely serious, associated with [[Vision abnormality SD-138|alterations of the visual field]] which can go as far as [[Vision abnormality SD-138|blindness]].

- Involvement of one or more periorbital muscles linked to oedematous phenomena, muscle inflammation and then muscle fibrosis, most often manifested by [[Diplopia SD-143|diplopia]].

question.title: What is a possible complication of basedowian ophthalmopathy?

option_a.title: Corneal damage and vision loss
option_a.description: A possible complication of basedowian ophthalmopathy

option_b.title: Neuropathy and vision loss due to compression of the optic nerve
option_b.description: A possible complication of basedowian ophthalmopathy

option_c.title: Involvement of the lacrimal gland and tear ducts
option_c.description: A possible complication of basedowian ophthalmopathy

option_d.title: Exophthalmos and diplopia due to muscle inflammation
option_d.description: A possible complication of basedowian ophthalmopathy

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The correct letter of the correct option
